reviews.review:
This was game of the year for me when it came out. It beat the Last of Us, and GTA 5,  Loved this game and played through it multiple times, i unlocked every achievment, and the fluid combat, outstanding storyline and beautiful environments never went stale. I'm 19, i have been gaming since i was 5, and this is without a doubt one of my favorite games of all time. Definetly pick this one up, you won't regret it! :)  

PS.  I know it says I only have a few mins in game, that is because i originally played this on ps3, before i could afford to build my gaming pc, and haven't yet had the time to play this on my pc.
Great game!
Melhor jogo ever!

Simplesmente perfeito graficos lindos e nao é muito pesado nao precisa de uma supermaquina pra roda-lo tranquilamente no ultra.. historia sem palavras um pouco confusa mais o final explica tudo recomendo que zerem o game quem gosta de uma boa historia como eu..
Booker, catch! Fun game, good times.
Ein sehr gutes Spiel.

BioShock Infinite это игра-шедевр! Непредсказуемые повороты сюжета, отличная графика, приятные для слуха звуковое оформление все это БиоШок. Геймплей отличный. Незабываемые полеты по аэро трассам, перестрелки все это выглядит шикарно! Я бы поставил это игре 110/100 баллов таких игр мало и они выходят редко.

E' un gioco maestoso, va giocato! Inoltre e' completamente godibile senza aver giocato i precedenti Bioshock.
Il finale e' da trip!
is one of the best FPS i have ever played

après avoir terminé la campagne en mode difficil une premiere fois un bilan s'impose : C'EST JOUISSIF !!!
le gameplay est tres agréable, intuitif, intense bref parfait !! et le clout du spéctacle un scénario digne des meilleurs films, ce qui est une chose rare de nos jours. le seul point négatif, on en voudrais plus !

[h1]Ein fantastisches Spiel mit unglaublich genialer Story![/h1]

Ich hatte am Ende der Hauptstory wirklich Gänsehaut... so stark hat mich dieses Spiel gepackt! Die ganze Story war mehr als nur top und gelungen. Werde mir demnächst auf jeden Fall den Season Pass holen! 

Mehr muss ich eigentlich nicht dazu sagen, da es genug andere positive Reviews dazu gibt, deren Meinungen ich mich nur anschließen kann. 

[b]TOP![/b]

Uno de los mejores juego que he jugado en mi vida. 

[h1]9.9/10[/h1]

My favourite BioShock so far. Columbia is way better than Rapture, in my opinion; the plot is better too, as the gameplay. All in all, a great FPS, definitely worth playing. Also, Elizabeth is amazing :-)
Simplesmente o melhor jogo que já joguei na minha vida!
Beautiful.
3+ часа в эту ПРЕКРАСНЕЙШУЮ игру!) и не надоедает) красота то какая) сюжет зацепил) музыка! одни +++ с моим компом выдало очень очень красивую картинку!! всем советую! стоит тех денеГ!!!!!
Игра офигенна, но в конце возникает ощущение что разрабы делали делали игру, а потом решили, "надоело, давайте закончим?" "давай!" и быстренько свернули разработку. Что очень обидно.

Dieses Spiel ist mit abstand das beste Kampagnen Spiel das ich kenne! 

ich kann es nur jedem weiter empfehlen!

this game is fantastic, 
the graphics and the game is worth a lot and cambito over its previous chapters
I am very satisfied
Worth every second of your time.

Auch wenn das Gameplay von Bioshock Inifnite vielleicht nicht an das des ersten Bioshock herankommt und nach einiger Zeit etwas wiederholend wirkt, ist es trotzdem eines der besten FPS, die ich je gespielt habe und das, vor allem wegen des unglaublichen Spieldesigns und der packenden Geschichte. Diese ist nicht hunderprozentig lückenlos, schon gar nicht leicht nachvollziehbar, sie lässt den Spieler aber nicht los und macht Lust auf mehr mit einem geradezu fantastischen Ende.

Bioshock ist eines dieser Spiele, die als Beispiel dafür angeführt werden, dass Spiele mehr als nur leichte Unterhaltung sein wollen / können - und das absolut zurecht. 
Von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

After constantly playing MP games all the time (ARMA 3, DayZ, RO2) I fancied a really good single player game with an engaging story. I was not dissapointed.

One of the most thrilling and best story-driven games I have played in recent years. The story left me thinking about it for days afterwards and I still do... The visuals are insanely nice, the setting is fantastic and beautiful, and the characters have depth and personality. 

Elizabeth feels less like the burden follower you get in most games and is actually an essential companion. She finds money, gives you ammo and health at the very moment you need it (which is insanely cool, she will shout "Booker, catch!" and will throw a medkit, machine gun ammo, salts for your vigors etc) and while you're exploring, she will explore the area herself independantly and return to you when it all kicks off. Honestly, you will rely on her and once you're finished you'll realise that the game itself would've been very difficult without her presence. 10/10 for the AI on this one!  

There was a period during the campaign that felt like it dragged a bit but once it was over with I was right back at it. The gameplay is very fluid and fans of the first two will easily adapt to the new terminology (Eve is now Salt, Plasmids are now Vigors etc). The skyrail system works very well if utilised properly but isn't essential to MOST areas.

100% recommended, I've finished Infinite and both episodes of Burial At Sea and I'm now moving onto the first Bioshock. 

DO NOT MISS THIS!
Excelente jogo.
One of the best narrative games.  If you can look past the slightly boring combat you will be hooked by the characters and settings

One of the best games in history. If you don't already own it then ou should and if you haven't already beaten it at least once then what are you waiting for? Tip top of the line FPS, tons of things to do, animation is gorgeous and the graphics are absolutely stunning. This game will take all of your current gen. graphics horsepower, but you'll love it every minute while its doing so. If you're a gamer, period, then this one comes recommended at the highest level.

Desde luego es un juego impresionante. Es cierto que es un shooter y con gráficos muy coloridos que pueden llevar a pensar que es un juego poco serio, pero aparte de la increíble cantidad de detalles gráficos que tiene, la historia que hay detrás del juego es magnífica. 

Con unos personajes (especialmente Elizabeth) con una psicología y un carácter que te hacen olvidarte del juego y reflexionar, su final es simplemente emotivo, inesperado, grandioso... Es uno de los pocos videojuegos en los que el final me ha marcado y mucho.

Lo recomiendo a cualquiera que le guste un shooter con algo de historia y aún más a los que les guste un juego entretenido con una buena historia detrás.

Trotz Bioshock-unüblichem setting ein echtes Bioschock.
Wem Bioshock 1 oder 2 gefallen hat wird auch dieses spiel mögen.
Die story ist atemberaubend und wunderschön.
Das gunplay ist nicht perfekt und warscheinlich der einzige echte kritikpunkt, es ist aber auch nicht wirklich schlimm und macht immer noch spaß.
ABSOLUTE kaufempfehlung, auch für vollpreiß.
Wer dieses spiel NICHT kauft wenn es mal wieder 'on sale' ist begeht einen sehr sehr schweren fehler.

Bioshock Infinite may not live up to the years of hype but it's still a fun game with some fantastic characters and brilliant world building. There are ways that it is better than the original Bioshock and ways that it's worse, ultimatly if you were a fan of a previous bioshock game you really can't go wrong at least giving this entry a try.
Loved this bioshock game.  It has compelled me to play the first two. really great storyline. blows your mind.
Beast game.
Игра скучная и не интересная.Не могу уже осилить год.Переоценённое говно

Fantastic game, it has so many angles besides just the combat mechanics. The darker sides to religion, racism, elitism and science all emerge in a foreshadowing manner. Take it from an old guy thats been gaming a while, if you emerge yourself in it, it will not disappoint.

Bioshock Infinite

Before I started this game, I honestly though it was going to be a let down of the series. Why? you ask. Well what is bioshock that isn't in Rapture, right? There was so much more they added it was scary, the story took my life for I did not leave my desk until I beat the game. It took about 16 hours which I am not going to lie, pretty big for what games are today. I was into the story as if I was Booker Dewitt. The game had me really think into the story, and how rich it is. If you know anything about the series, I couldn't recommend the game more. If you are new to the series it is still a amazing game. The DLC is meant for people who has prior experience with the series. The gameplay was oddly different, but not bad but not mindblowing. It was more for an amazing story though.

"Why do you ask what / when the delicious question is when? / The only difference between past and present / ...is semantics. / Lives, lived, will live. / Dies, died, will die. / If we could perceive time as it really was... / what reason would grammar professors have to get out of bed? / Like us all, Lady Comstock exists across time. / She is both alive and dead. / She perceives being both. / She finds this condition... disagreeable." - Robert and Rosalind Lutece

9.5/10

본편도 굉장하지만... dlc를 보고 감탄 할수밖에 없었다.. 바이오쇼크1이랑 이렇게 엮었을줄 누가 알았을까.. 본편만 하지마시고 꼭 dlc도 즐기시길 바랍니다. 진짜 하는내내 사소한거 하나하나에서 놀라게 되네요. 물론 하기전에 바이오쇼크1은 꼭 해보시길!

Bioshock Infinite is a game I wanted very much to like, but I cannot recommend it. It's not the dissonance between the story and the gameplay or how the story is thinner than tissue paper until the end or how the game pretends to explore deep themes while really only using Americana as an aesthetic. No, all that would have been excused if the gameplay could hold it up. Gunplay in Infinite is just as floaty and flaccid as the first Bioshock, and now a new shield system dramatically slows the pace of the game. I found myself hunkering down behind walls, waiting for that miniscule recharching bar to replenish. This, coupled with the lack of an inventory, makes for a game with very little flexibility. Unless you're really looking only for a pretty game, skip Infinite.
복잡한 내용 재미있는 총질 액션

The gameplay isn't always the greatest; however, the game is absolutely beautiful: visually, musically, and emotionally.  I liked the story okay, but absolutely loved the characters in it.  They stuck with me long after I finished the game itself.  The first Bioshock blew my mind and Bioshock Infinite broke my heart.

If you enjoyed Bioshock Infinite, the Bioshock Burial at Sea DLCs are a must-buy.  The Clash in the Clouds DLC was decent fun for Steam sale prices; I mostly played it to unlock the modern songs done in the old-timey style.

I really enjoyed Bioshock Infinite. I wont give any spoilers, but I will say.. it really made me sad about playing Bioshock. Anyhow the game is great. The story is phenomenal. I didnt know what was going to happen next. The scenary is classic Bioshock, I looked at this before playing and thought.. this is to bright and happy to be as good as the original BIoshock. I can easily say Bioshock Infinite has better replayability to me than Bioshock 1 or 2. The plasmids are great to deal with and combing them with  other plasmids, weapons or just environment is great fun. I easily got over 30 hours of gameplay from this wonderful game. And the DLC can not be missed "Burial at Sea" DO NOT PLAY the DLC if you have not played the original BIoshock. I told a friend you could technically play Infinite if you hadnt played the original. You would just get a little lost at some things that are " oh yeah" moments.

Great shooter and it has probably has one of the best stories out there in a game. It's an amazing addition to the Bioshock series as the gameplay is fun and challenging giving you tons of new powers to play around with. The story of the DLC also connects the universe of this game to the universe of the original Bioshock in Rapture, which is pretty damn awesome.

While the game mechanics may not be unique, the story is amazing and is somewhat similar to inception in that your mind will be blown. I highly suggest this if you enjoy story based games with a cool fps side to them.
BEST GAME IVE EVER PLAYED

Bioshock Infinite is a wholeheartedly great experience, that lives up to its pedigree. While far more linear than the last Bioshock (and somewhat less worthy of multiple playthroughs) it showcases a lot of immersion and incredible production value. The storyline and setting are packed with imagination and wholly worth the cost of admission--even though the game probably clocks about a shy 10 hours total. This is a gamer's game, no mistake, don't think that the experience is going to deviate too greatly from every other FPS out there; lots of head-shots and violence await your trip through the city in the sky. The mood is cavaliering and the run-and-gun action is a great break from the cover-based monotony that has become the norm. The world is very well fleshed out, and the spectacle hits you full force. The ending is one of the best conclusions in recent memory and elevates every moment proceeding it in its profundity.

Admittedly, the gameplay has slightly less depth than the previous Bioshock. But it's not terribly lacking for it, instead it feels streamlined. There is far less choice in this game as well, but the game is focused on a single storyline instead. I'd definitely advise everyone who has enjoyed a shooter in the past to give this game a go (and play the first one first). It's a thrilling story arc and a great showcase of the power of first-person immersion in a virtual world.

There are games and there is Art. This game is the latter. It's not just a great shooter (which it also is), but it's a game where you emotionally bond with the characters and the story, with a very detailed world, great dialogues, a couple of good jokes and easter eggs. The game is also rather bald in the way it mocks religion, racism and patriotism and portrays the early America. The gameplay itself is in perfection: the way they innovated the idea of a proper gameplay companion, the tactical combat (tears and skylines with constant lack of proper ammunition), the choice of vigor upgrades and weapons, the nice RPG elements it's all there.

The difficulty is challenging on the "hard" difficulty, I died about 10 times before the last combat scene, and I was unable to finish the last combat mission on "hard" in 4 attempts (lowered the difficulty because I really wanted to find out what happens in the end). The challenge is increased due to the "auto-save" system, which I found appropriate for this game. I enjoyed everything about this game except for the ending. Without giving away any spoilers I will just say, that I find it in contradiction with the plot and simply not enjoyable with too much mysticism for my rational mind to handle. I would also like to say that the game runs really smooth on my nvidea 570gtx with no lags. I was unable to find any bugs during the gameplay. It's an example of a successfull port from the console. 10 for graphics and optimization 10 for gameplay 10 for originality and concept 10 for character and game design 8 for the plot (mostly because of the ending). It's good, just not as great as it could be in my oppinion.
Me lo tuve que pasar unas 7 veces para entender la historia. La jugabilidad y TODO me encanto.

Го в но, вообще не понравилось. Графон замыленный (играл в 1920х1080 на ультра настройках), это из-за того, что под PLAYSTATION 3 графон точили, из этого получаем мыло и текстуры низкого разрешения. Сюжет тоже ерунда, типо параллельные миры и т.д. Врагов убивать не приятно, только бесят. И концовка игры вообще ерунда, типо тебя топят, чтоб так много параллельных миров не было, но тогда вопрос, если в конце ГГ(главный герой) утонул, а это типо получается до того как главный герой попадает в Колумбию, то и спасать (Анну/Элизебет) я  не должен был, так как ГГ был бы мёртв. В общем, сюжет чисто под наркотой придуман. Играть в это одно мучение, кое как прошёл с перерывами. Игра кстати примерно 8 часов идёт, но из-за того, что го в но, кажется, что часов 12 и больше.
Оценка 4/10.

Играя в BioShock Infinite не покидало чувство, что это просто хороший шутан с неплохим сюжетом.  Но это до концовки... После неё буквально срыв башки! Целый день ходил и думал, думал и передумывал. И наконец понял что это не просто игра- ШЕДЕВР. А шедевр в мире игр выходит ой как не часто. И ели вы сторник сюжетных игр, я вам яро советую в неё сыграть, и пройти.
 P.S. Элизабет может составить серьзную конкуренцию Аликс Венс, как боевая подруга.+ ещё она спортсменка, магичка(комсомолка), и просто красавица.
Ein Meisterwerk.

Its far from a perfect 10/10 game, its far from having the same mechanics as the first two Bioshock, but its still a good and very entertaining game. 
Let me first talk about the things I didn't like and then I'll go to the thinks I liked.
Bioshock Infiite lacks what most people have already pointed out, a full list of options like we had in the first two games. We can only carry two weapons and a small amount of ammo. Its realistic, not to mention everytime we're the middle of a battle, there will be weapons available in some corner, and soldiers always drop weapons. But its not the same thing. We can't fully upgrade something choosing some kind of class, or make that weapon specialized in killing a type of enemy. This time we have Vigors that kill a type of enemy or stun a type of enemy. Now that I mentionvigors, we have a huge list that's completely pointless. We can finish the game using only one type of vigor, and some of them are just completely pointless. Vigors like Charge, that might be fun to use, becames useless because you can only use it on an enemy at the same, which ends up consuming a lot of your salts. 
Most frustrating moment for me, The battle with the Siren drives me insane. I hated it the first time and even more the second. Its simply cringe worthy and frustrating, a waste of ammo and salts, because the enemies you killed once, you kill them again, and Mrs Commstockflies around in a weird pattern, making it difficult to become a target. 
The final battle. Let me tell you how little prepared we are for the final battle. I found it that when I played this game for the first time, I wasn't in the least preparedfor the final battle, considering you're only allowed to travel along with two weapons, and those might not be the weapons you have fully upgraded, you can might be walking into your doom. You're given almost all the enemies you fought before, all at the same time (Almost, the crow, and fireman aren't in the final battle, which would have made things even more ridiculous) You're not sure what's going on, until half the bar for the ship is already gone, then you realize you were supposed to defend that blue bright thing. Its a mess. 
But I was able to play this game a second time, I gave it more time and I slowly played through different paths and made different choices (Constants and variables). 

I did like this game, after the first and second playthrough, I liked every little bit, finding moments of frustration along. I advice you to play it because even though it has all the problems I pointed out before, and probably more depending on the experience of other players, its still a great full and entertaining moment. You're left on the edge of your seat because you just want to know who is Elizabeth, and at a certain point, who are you. In the mission with Slate you think your past and story is all coverd, but as the time goes by, you realize its not like that at all. 
The first time I played it I just wanted to play more and uncover what was going on. Who were the people who wanted you to "Bring them the girl". Second time I played with more time and patience, knowing the story already, I took the time to explore and find out more about Colombia. 
Oh, and Colombia, though. My congratulations to the artist in ths game for the beauty that slowly died away and gave place to destruction, to the writter who gave us a Disney princess Elizabeth making her slowly grow up and find out more about herself, that gave us the Luttece, Commstock, Daisy and Fink, to the sound team who gave us an amazing sountrack like always, bringing oldies transforming them into something that felt like it belong to Colombia. It was delicious to play through this game and find these characters, and story so interesting. 
A good thing I have to say about the combat and upgrade is that, this time you can upgrade yourself with the Gear, making amazing combinations that would make you a perfect killing machine, depending on what type of gameplay you wanted to make. The Vigors might have been too many, but you could still make perfect combinations between them, and between the weapons, you could plan strategies or just go full killing mode. 
Yes, I recommend it even though it fails in a lot of ways, and it definetly its not a 10/10, but its worth the buy and worth your time.

I love this game!
Combat and gameplay in general are fun and the characters are deep and complex (especially the Lutece twins), the retro atmosphere, the weapons, the stylized graphics, everything is in the right place.
Bioshock Infinite is simply breathtaking, playing it is a must.

épic game :D

I absolutely adored Bioshock Infinite. I can't remember ever being as blown away by a video game like this. 
Pros:
-Exciting gameplay,
-Fantastic setting
-Beautiful art that doesn't rely on hyper-realism, like many games try (and fail) to acheive. 
-Gripping story, with a thought provoking ending that will leave you thinking about it for a couple of days. 
-Interesting characters

Cons:
-There are people who have not experienced this game.

Seriosly. If you have any appreciation for a good story with good characters, you need to play this game. Even if you aren't a huge fan of shooters, I still highly reccomend this game, as the story itself is worth it. 

10/10

Probably the best story line game ive ever played. Gameplay was amazing, and of course the graphics, the ending will set you to chills. And when a game put chills too me, i know ive played one of the most greatest game ever made.

Um jogo incrivel que nos trás um ambiente rustico combinado com vários detalhes Steampunk... ficou muito fiel ao classico mistério e sanguinolencia da série Bioshock, e continuará sendo um dos melhores jogos que já joguei!

This game blew my mind. Honestly coming into this i had few hopes beyond its graphical beauty. I had freinds who swore by it so i picked it up in the summer sale and let me tell you, it was worth every penny just to see the final cutscene. The effort put into the story of the game is the most i have seen in all of my years gaming, the sheer cleverness and originality is beyond any movie or game ever made. That is why Bioshock: Infinite has bumped its way to the number one spot on the list of my favorite games of all time. 10/10 Never seen anything like it

Eerily similar yet deliciously distinct, Infinite seperates itself from the pack while maintaining the core values that made the Bioshock franchise great. Infinite was a breath of fresh air as far as "endings" to a trilogy go. The environments were lush and immersive. The enemies were unique, bountiful and challenging. Infinite blends just the right amound of gameplay and rich, captivating story, although at times, the story feels overbearing and gives you the sensation as if you're drowning. By all means, it could be argued that this was the best installment of the franchise (the most polished at the least) but I find it a stretch to say that it trumps the original.
Didnt live up to what was shown in the E3 footage, a good game overall, but is missing something the first bioshock game had.
